comments.value: This is an outstanding request from Morag dating back from August. If we have anything to hand (from an old pitch document, perhaps), that would be a very helpful start.

Don't think I was in the loop on that earlier request. This isn't my bag though - I imagine it would mostly be K, with some help from J. So I'm reassigning it. But even if it's chargeable as you suggest, it seems a bit unlikely theywill be able to prioritize over other work any time soon.
Ticket #59 "Technical specification" was closed and merged into this ticket.

I have spoken to Gianfranco and he has the following requests for this piece of work.

We are still working on the exact definition of what we will demand of all our suppliers in the next future, but the general list of technical documents will look like the following:

1)       the solution architecture of the service 

2)       its deployment (e.g description of current instance, general principles for future deployments, firewall requirements, load balancing capabilities…) and 

3)       its ‘operations manual’ (e.g. how to monitor, backup, start-up and shut-down, list of software licences with suppliers names and expiration dates…)  

Hope that is helpful!
I am closing this. Most of this information has been supplied in a separate document some time ago. If any more information is needed a new ticket can be raised.

The getRelatedPages in the nav Package doesn't seem to return sorted results ~ could someone look at the function please?
Changed to high on Liz' request
effort estimate?

Have just emailed Lars:
  This seems to have been fixed.
  Or - at least - Liz's examples don't seem to exhibit the problem any more.
  Did you fix it? 
Am wondering though - perhaps it is just the "non-matching" related pages that exihibit this problem. (non-matching means "match a few tags" rather than "match all tags"). These might have dropped off the bottom of the list for some other reason.
Will investigate further once Lars has confirmed the above.

Briefly, Navigation.getRelatedPages() gets pages in the following order:
1. Any pages that match some or all of this page's tags & metadata, from the last 30 days, best match first.
2. Any pages that match some or all of this page's tags & metadata, from OUTSIDE of the last 30 days, best match first.
3. Any other pages, most recent first.

It only moves to 2, 3, if there are not enough results in 1.

My guess is that (2.) can - in some sicrumstances - return results that score high on relevance, but are very old.

If it's proved that this is the problem, then one possible solution would be to replace (2.) with:
2.1. Matching pages between 30 days and 1 year in age, best match first.
2.2. Matching pages older than 1 year, best match first.

Have implemented the above, with the following slight change:
Related pages are now found as follows:

1. Any pages that match some or all of this page's tags & metadata, from the last 30 days, best match first.
2.1. Matching pages between 30 days and 90 days, best match first.
2.2. Matching pages older than 90 days, ordered by most-recent postDate
3. Any other pages, ordered by most-recent postDate.

Could be paraphrased as:
1. Recent pages, most relevant first.
2.1. Fairly recent pages, most relevant first.
2.1. Older related pages, most recent first. 
3. Unrelated (but similar) pages, most recent first (only used in rare occasions where there's no other match).

Can you confirm that the following pages now show relavent recent-enough photos please?

  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/venues/olympic-stadium.php
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/venues/aquatics-centre.php

(remember that when previewing these pages in the cms, you can click on the image and it will give you an indication of why it was considered "related").

The truncated display names are a duplicate of (two or three) other tickets (which I'm moving on to next) so I think this ticket (pending the above) should be closed.
I think this is fine.  Alex, can you confirm you're happy?
Kieran: can you add your actual days to this and mark as solved. thanks.

Hi Alex,

Are you linking to the photo *page* or photo (image) itself ?

I wasn't trying to link to a photo at all, but a venue page. But the
photos pages seem to be coming up first (we had this issue a few months
ago which you fixed but it seems to have just gone back). Search should
bring up content pages first not photos...

 

________________________________

Hi Kieran,

Bit hard to see how we weight this in a sensible way (without hard coding, which I want to avoid as next week they complain that another page type should be coming up first) 

I guess the problem is that photo pages has better meta tags or title?

Any thoughts? bounce back to me and I'll happily explain why we can't do this.

thanks

Jamie

I have changed the weighting so that matches on /name/, especially /exact/ matches are now especially boosted. This seems to have fixed this particular problem. However, as is common with this sort of tweaking, there /might/ be results appearing elsewhere that someone might consider "oddly-ordered". I'm fairly confident, though, that there aren't any circumstances where boosting name-matches would cause a problem.
For reference, the Photo Page matches are all due to them being /tagged/ to "Olympic stadium".
Marking as solved.

The Webcams and Virtual tours are currently just loaded into pages based on latest first, this is largely because Virtual tours we're all of the park, based on month and therefore we assumed that latest tour was the most sensible. 

On the homepage and WebCam hub page we currently pull them in based on a 'navigation order' (I think you wnat to leave that as it stands). But, yes obviously where there is an associated webcam it makes sense to try and present this first on relevant venue page. 

We are proposing to change the behavior of both to work in a contextual fashion on the RHS promo where applicable (generic content or venue pages)

Jamie

Jamie, can you please not start work on this until I've gotten a better grip on what has been requested?

Thanks!
